SEARCH
Package org.example.model.chaosgame

Class ChaosGame

java.lang.Object
org.example.model.chaosgame.ChaosGame
public class ChaosGame extends Object

ChaosGame.

A class that represents a chaos game. The game is generated based on a description and a canvas.

The chaos game extends the Game class, and is used to transform a given point based on randomly selected transforms from a given description. The transformed point increases in value in the canvas, and the canvas is updated after the given number of steps is run.

Since:
0.2.0
Version:
1.0.0

  • Method Details

    • setDescription

      public void setDescription(ChaosGameDescription description)
      Sets the description of this chaos game. The canvas is reset to a new canvas based on the description. Notifies all observers that the description has changed.
      Parameters:
      description - is the description to use.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given description is null.

    • updateDescription

      public void updateDescription()
      Updates the description of this chaos game. The canvas is reset to a new canvas based on the description. Notifies all observers that the description has changed.

    • changeZoom

      Parameters:

    • runSteps

      public void runSteps(int steps)
      Runs the chaos game for the given number of steps. Notifies all observers that the canvas has changed after all steps have been run.
      Parameters:
      steps - is the number of steps to run.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given number of steps is not positive.

    • verifyValidCanvasSize

      protected void verifyValidCanvasSize(int width, int height)

      height - the height to verify

    • verifyStepsPositive

      protected void verifyStepsPositive(int steps)
      Verifies that the given steps is more than zero. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the given steps is less than or equal to zero.
      Parameters:
      steps - the steps to verify
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given steps is less than or equal to zero
